verses.text: These are the inheritances that the Israelites received in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites allotted to them.
verses.comment: Faithful to Hebrew; 'received' translated per modern usage. 'Heads of the fathers’ houses' rendered as 'heads of the families' for clarity.

verses.text: Their inheritance was by lot, just as the LORD had commanded through Moses, for the nine and a half tribes.
verses.comment: 'By lot' kept literal, as in Hebrew. Cross references as in text.

verses.text: Because Moses had given the inheritance of the two and a half tribes beyond the Jordan; but to the Levites he gave no inheritance among them.
verses.comment: Literal phrasing reflects original. 'Beyond the Jordan' maintains Hebrew geography.

verses.text: For the sons of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, and they gave no portion of the land to the Levites, except cities to live in, with their pastures for their livestock and their possessions.
verses.comment: Clarifies sons of Joseph as the two tribes; rest as in original.

verses.text: The Israelites did just as the LORD commanded Moses; so they divided the land.
verses.comment: Closely follows Hebrew syntax and sense.

verses.text: Then the people of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, 'You know what the LORD said to Moses the man of God concerning me and you at Kadesh-barnea.'
verses.comment: 'Kenizzite' and 'Kadesh-barnea' left as transliterations for accuracy.

verses.text: 'I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the LORD sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I brought back word to him as it was in my heart.'
verses.comment: 'Servant of the LORD' retained as literal; 'as it was in my heart' = true to Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: 'But my brothers who went up with me made the heart of the people melt; yet I wholly followed the LORD my God.'
verses.comment: Literal rendering; 'made the heart...melt' is a Hebrew idiom for discouraging the people.

verses.text: 'So Moses swore on that day, saying, Surely the land where your foot has trodden will be an inheritance for you and your children forever, because you have wholly followed the LORD my God.'
verses.comment: 'Swore on that day' literal; 'trod' kept as 'trodden' for close accuracy.

verses.text: 'And now, look, the LORD has kept me alive, just as he said, these forty-five years, since the LORD spoke this word to Moses, while Israel walked in the wilderness; and now, here I am today, eighty-five years old.'
'I am still as strong today as I was the day Moses sent me; as my strength was then, so is my strength now, for war and for going out and for coming in.'
verses.comment: 'For going out and coming in' is a Hebraism for all kinds of activity.

verses.text: 'Now therefore give me this hill country of which the LORD spoke on that day, for you heard on that day how the Anakim were there, with great fortified cities. It may be that the LORD will be with me, and I will drive them out as the LORD said.'
verses.comment: 'Hill country' for 'mountain,' per most modern translations.

verses.text: So Joshua blessed him, and he gave Hebron to Caleb son of Jephunneh as an inheritance.
Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he wholly followed the LORD, the God of Israel.
Now the name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba; Arba was the greatest man among the Anakim. And the land had rest from war.
verses.comment: 'Kiriath-arba' and 'Anakim' as transliterations per most versions. 'The land had rest' literal.
